3. If there is a match on May 7, 2005, find its opponent and result.
4. Compare the opponent and result of May 7 with the opponent and result of May 10, 2005 to determine if they are the same team (since they both should be part of Chelsea's schedule on those dates).
5. If the opponents and results match for May 7 and May 10, it means that Chelsea played a game on May 10 as well. In this case, find the opponent and result of the May 10 game.
6. Compare the opponent and result of May 10 with the rest of the matches in the table to verify if there is another match between May 10 and May 15, 2005 (since the claim suggests that the season ends on May 15). If there is no match after May 10 or the opponent/result doesn't match with any other games in the range, it means the season ended on May 10.

- Find the row corresponding to May 7, 2005 and verify if there is a match that day.
